quiz.definition: A set of instructions or statements to perform a specific task in a computer program.
hints: It is an essential part of programming.
Developers write it.
It is executed by computers.

quiz.definition: The process of arranging elements in a particular order or sequence.
hints: It is important for organizing data.
It helps in achieving efficiency.
It involves putting things in a structured manner.

quiz.definition: A small piece of code that performs a specific task and can be reused.
hints: It promotes code reusability.
It encapsulates functionality.
It is often named after its purpose.

quiz.definition: A sequence of steps or instructions designed to solve a specific problem.
hints: It is used to solve complex problems.
It can be implemented in various programming languages.
It often involves logical reasoning.

quiz.definition: A named storage location in a program that holds a value that can be changed.
hints: It stores data.
It can hold different types of values.
It is used to store and manipulate information.

quiz.definition: A structured collection of data that is organized and accessible.
hints: It stores large amounts of data.
It allows efficient retrieval and manipulation of data.
It can be relational or non-relational.

quiz.definition: A block of organized, reusable code that performs a specific task.
hints: It promotes modularity and code reuse.
It can accept input and produce output.
It helps in breaking down complex problems into manageable parts.

quiz.definition: The process of repeating a set of instructions multiple times.
hints: It involves loops.
It allows performing repetitive tasks.
It can be controlled using conditionals.

quiz.definition: A point of interaction between a user and a computer system or between two systems.
hints: It allows users to interact with a program.
It defines how components communicate with each other.
It can be graphical or command-line based.

quiz.definition: The process of finding and fixing errors or defects in a program.
hints: It is done to identify and resolve issues.
It involves testing and analyzing code.
It improves the quality and reliability of software.

quiz.definition: The set of rules that govern the structure and composition of a program.
hints: It defines how code is written and organized.
It must be followed for code to be valid.
It varies across different programming languages.

quiz.definition: A named storage location in a program that holds a value that can be changed.
hints: It stores data.
It can hold different types of values.
It is used to store and manipulate information.

quiz.definition: The process of translating source code into machine code or an executable program.
hints: It is performed by a compiler.
It converts high-level code to low-level code.
It checks for syntax and semantic errors.

quiz.definition: A sequence of steps or instructions designed to solve a specific problem.
hints: It is used to solve complex problems.
It can be implemented in various programming languages.
It often involves logical reasoning.

quiz.definition: A tool used to identify and fix errors or defects in a program.
hints: It allows stepping through code for inspection.
It provides tools for analyzing program state.
It aids in understanding program behavior.

quiz.definition: A collection of precompiled code and resources that can be used by software programs.
hints: It provides reusable functions and modules.
It saves development time.
It offers ready-made solutions to common problems.

quiz.definition: Facts, statistics, or information that is stored and used by a computer.
hints: It is processed by computer programs.
It can be in various forms, such as numbers or text.
It is the foundation of information systems.

quiz.definition: A programming construct that repeats a set of instructions until a specific condition is met.
hints: It allows repetitive execution of code.
It can be controlled using conditions.
It helps in automating repetitive tasks.

quiz.definition: The process of finding and fixing errors or defects in a program.
hints: It is done to identify and resolve issues.
It involves testing and analyzing code.
It improves the quality and reliability of software.

quiz.definition: A sequence of steps or instructions designed to solve a specific problem.
hints: It is used to solve complex problems.
It can be implemented in various programming languages.
It often involves logical reasoning.

quiz.definition: A blueprint for creating objects, providing initial values and behaviors.
hints: It defines the properties and methods of objects.
It supports the concept of inheritance.
It is a fundamental building block in object-oriented programming.

quiz.definition: A tool used to identify and fix errors or defects in a program.
hints: It allows stepping through code for inspection.
It provides tools for analyzing program state.
It aids in understanding program behavior.

quiz.definition: A function or process that calls itself directly or indirectly.
hints: It involves self-referencing.
It can solve problems by breaking them into smaller instances.
It requires a base case to terminate.

quiz.definition: The process of simplifying complex systems by representing essential features.
hints: It hides unnecessary details.
It focuses on the most relevant aspects.
It aids in managing complexity in software design.

quiz.definition: The process in which a function calls itself directly or indirectly.
hints: It is a fundamental concept in computer science.
It allows solving problems by dividing them into smaller instances.
It requires a base case to prevent infinite loops.

quiz.definition: The ability of a class to inherit properties and behaviors from another class.
hints: It promotes code reuse.
It supports hierarchical relationships.
It allows creating specialized classes based on a common base.

quiz.definition: A structured collection of data that is organized and accessible.
hints: It stores large amounts of data.
It allows efficient retrieval and manipulation of data.
It can be relational or non-relational.

quiz.definition: The ability of objects of different types to be accessed and used through a common interface.
hints: It allows objects to be treated uniformly.
It supports dynamic method dispatch.
It promotes flexibility and extensibility in object-oriented programming.

quiz.definition: The set of rules that govern the structure and composition of a program.
hints: It defines how code is written and organized.
It must be followed for code to be valid.
It varies across different programming languages.

quiz.definition: A self-contained unit that encapsulates related functions and data.
hints: It promotes modularity and code organization.
It can be imported and reused in other programs.
It helps in separating concerns and improving maintainability.

quiz.definition: A way of organizing and storing data to perform efficient operations.
hints: It provides a specific layout for data storage.
It determines the efficiency of algorithms.
Examples include arrays, linked lists, and trees.
